metadata.title: CVE-2020-12415 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: When "%2F" was present in a manifest URL, Firefox's AppCache behavior mayhave become confused and allowed a manifest to be served from asubdirectory. This could cause the appcache to be used to service requestsfor the top level directory. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 78.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
